answers.answer: If it is not diet soda, that is one heck of a sugar load.  I think it is the equivalent to 12 teaspoons of sugar in a 12-ounce can.  And unfortunately, if it is diet soda, it is loaded with chemicals.  Hate to say it because the sugar gives you a higher diabetes risk and a higher risk that your child will later on develop diabetes, and the chemicals are just nasty for you.  Can you taper off by cutting the soda in half with sparkling water?  And then just doing only sparkling water with a splash or two of orange juice or grape juice?  So much better for you.
Yes! Flavored corbonated water doesnt taste bad to me & much better for u! One can is fine, but 3 is alot of sugar a day in my opinion for pregnant ladies
You already at the end of the pregnancy I see no harm as long as your drinking water as well.

Oh my someone going through my exact same issue, I love soda especially Pepsi. At 37 weeks and still can't control my soda intake. My baby as of now is perfect. I on the other hand have had many UTIs which I do in fact blame the soda. But its so hard for me to stop drinking it.

I drank tons of water throughout my whole pregnancy, for a while thats all i was drinking but in the last month i've been craving soda with my meals so ive been having that alot lately too. Your supposed to be healthy and soda is obviously bad for you so just try to limit your intake and try to drink water too.
You are at the end but if it's not caffeine free your baby could go thru caffeine withdrawal. Drink as much water as you can between your sodas.

question: I'm 39weeks pregnant and I've been drinking atleast 3 cans of soda a day will it effect my pregnancy?
title: Soda soda
